text: Molecular mechanisms underlying selective expression of cytokines by T cells remain poorly understood .

Here we show that priming of <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> T cells selectively enhances <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression relative to <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression by a transcriptional mechanism involving nuclear factor of activated T cells ( NFAT ) proteins .

As detected by in vivo footprinting , priming markedly increases the activation - dependent engagement of the P0 and P1 NFAT-binding elements of the <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .

text: Moreover , each proximal P element is essential for optimal <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter activity .
